character.name: Aisha

appearance.hair: dark black hair, usually hidden under hijab outside home; when at home, worn in a neat bun
appearance.distinguishing_features: round pleasant face with a wide warm smile, wears hijab always when outside home (various colors: purple, teal, burgundy, cream), occasionally hennaed hands on special occasions

character.occupation: Owner of Hoyo's Kitchen, a small Somali restaurant in Cedar-Riverside neighborhood, Minneapolis. Cooks, manages two staff members, handles catering orders. Serves lunch and dinner.
character.living_situation: Three-bedroom townhouse in Cedar-Riverside neighborhood, Minneapolis, Minnesota with husband Abdi (43, ride-share driver), son Hamza (15, high school), daughter Amina (11, middle school), daughter Zahra (5, kindergarten), and orange tabby cat Basra

style.sleep: Long cotton nightgown, dark hair in a loose bun, no hijab
style.home_morning: House dress or long Somali tunic (dirac) over leggings, no hijab, hair in a bun
style.restaurant_work: Hijab (usually teal or cream), long-sleeved tunic top, comfortable pants, closed-toe shoes, apron over everything
style.going_out: Hijab, long modest dress or tunic with pants, comfortable shoes

background.family: Married to Abdi, three children: Hamza (15), Amina (11), Zahra (5). Orange tabby cat named Basra.
background.faith: Practicing Muslim, observes five daily prayers (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha), keeps halal diet
background.culture: Somali American, strong ties to Cedar-Riverside Somali community in Minneapolis. Traditional Somali cooking, tea culture (shaah), family-centered values.
background.pet: Orange tabby cat named Basra, indoor cat, lazy and affectionate

hijab when outside home (various colors: teal, cream, purple, burgundy)
dark hair in bun when at home without hijab

notes.educational_context: This character represents a Somali American working mother and small business owner. Shows restaurant/cooking profession, Islamic faith practices, Somali culture, and busy family life in Minneapolis.
notes.cultural_context: Minneapolis Cedar-Riverside Somali community, Somali cuisine and restaurant culture, Islamic daily practices (five prayers, hijab, halal), Minnesota winter setting, immigrant community strength
notes.pedagogical_goal: Help learners see diverse representation while learning vocabulary through a relatable working mother's daily activities including restaurant cooking, family care, cultural practices, and community life
